intro: Marsdenia rzedowskiana, commonly known as the Rzedowska Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by follicle fruits. It is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
